content:
Hello @WG-prioritization I'm writing a blog post for the Rust official blog to help onboarding newcomers to this working group. Here is a first draft:
https://hackmd.io/XDbAAHTbTGqhSVRgN_Zdlg

I'd like to have your comments, the file should be editable by anyone in the Rust Lang hackmd team. I'd say to publish this in a couple of days (say, by end of this week push a PR with the final version).

Additions, typo fixes, comments, ideas ... anything is more than welcome to improve it. I've left a few TODOs around to point out parts I think need improvements.

Thank you so much for a review :-)
This is really awesome! :tada:
if everyone is ok with this we can probably open a PR on the blog repo, I guess
:+1: from me

I've have published a draft PR for the blog
https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/686

@WG-prioritization feel free to give a last glance, thanks!

@Santiago Pastorino suggestions for the publishing date? For the moment is set to 2020-09-10
Will take a look :)

Can anyone explain me why in the world github applied this label to this PR?

apiraino requested a review from rust-lang/core as a code owner 1 hour ago

I certainly did not do that. I didn't want to bother more people than necessary :-/
I believe it’s automatic, you shouldn’t worry about it
i think it's how codeowners work automatically
https://docs.github.com/en/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/about-code-owners
oh I see, thanks

I read the post. Looks really nice, and I feel more confident about being able to help. One thing I think it could do a better job of is getting people excited to participate. The post mentions how cool the compiler team is but not the prioritization team. This team is the first line of defense against bugs! Rust depends on this team to keep things stable. Play that up more :wink:
Also, do you want to have a dedicated topic for beginner questions or do you expect beginners to create new topics with questions?

apiraino said:

I've have published a draft PR for the blog
https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/686

@WG-prioritization feel free to give a last glance, thanks!

Santiago Pastorino suggestions for the publishing date? For the moment is set to 2020-09-10

just made some comments there, about the publish date whatever is fine to me :)

hey @Ryan Levick thanks for the suggestions. I think we can have beginners (as everyone else) open topics at will, Zulip works fine with this interaction model. Still, it would be a good idea to explicit this in the blog post (not everyone may be familiar with Zulip).
I'll also rerun the GPT-3 endpoint ;-) and cheer up the blog post a little bit

Ryan Levick said:

Also, do you want to have a dedicated topic for beginner questions or do you expect beginners to create new topics with questions?

The way we work is that we have #t-compiler/wg-prioritization for general discussions and #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts where topics are automatically opened by triagebot requesting the team to prioritize issues, I'd expect people (no matter if beginners or experts) to open topics on #t-compiler/wg-prioritization
unsure if we want to add this information to the blog but whatever you prefer @apiraino

Santiago Pastorino said:

unsure if we want to add this information to the blog but whatever you prefer apiraino

This is pretty important information. I'd add it to the post

@Santiago Pastorino 

just made some comments there, about the publish date whatever is fine to me :)

thanks for the comments! I will give it another look.
By the way - I failed to mention that the blog post is Santiago's idea (credit where credit is due), I've just scribbled some words down :pencil: :smile:

apiraino said:

Santiago Pastorino 

just made some comments there, about the publish date whatever is fine to me :)

thanks for the comments! I will give it another look.
By the way - I failed to mention that the blog post is Santiago's idea (credit where credit is due), I've just scribbled some words down :pencil: :smile:

@apiraino this is going to happen thanks to you, I'm very happy to share some info and review the PR :)

The blog post will be merged real soon, yay! Now I wonder if I should also take care of pushing it to TWIR (this week in rust) and "ReadRust" (https://readrust.net/submit).

Does the official Rust blog have an internal work cycle also for spreading new posts?
it will just get posted and shared in different places
ah ok, thanks
@apiraino, just in case because I've commented on github and then edited my comment, you're right, let's update the date for tomorrow, Niko told me that today the survey is gonna be announced

Santiago Pastorino said:

apiraino, just in case because I've commented on github and then edited my comment, you're right, let's update the date for tomorrow, Niko told me that today the survey is gonna be announced

it's done :thumbs_up:
@Santiago Pastorino send me a ping when you want to resume the merge of this PR and I'll update the publishing date (no rush, of course) :thumbs_up:
cc @nikomatsakis
should we use today's date and merge it now? or maybe it's better to do it early tomorrow?
@Santiago Pastorino if you update to today's date, I'll merge
I say let's do it :)
sorry
@apiraino we you can update it please let us know
doing that in a couple of minutes :thumbs_up:

done @nikomatsakis

thanks!
@apiraino merging!

uhmm ... why do I see the blog post twice?
/me checking the PR ...

@nikomatsakis a stray file that was merged, could you please merge PR #693 to fix?
https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/693
(my apologies)
@apiraino done
thanks

https://twitter.com/spastorino/status/1305626604912205825

A call for contributors from the WG-prioritization team https://blog.rust-lang.org/2020/09/14/wg-prio-call-for-contributors.html. Feel free to reach out to me if you want to get involved.

- Santiago Pastorino (@spastorino)
twitted about it as a way to spread the word
great work @apiraino
Looking forward to the meeting Wednesday!
@DJ Carpenter :wave:, sorry but there may be some wrong information around, what meeting are you referring to?

Yup, my bad, I thought it said the meetup was after the compiler meeting Wednesday 6 UTC.

It looks like Thursday/Friday. Thanks
@DJ Carpenter what we usually do is on wednesday's we fill most of the agenda for the compiler team meeting that happens on thursday's
but we don't have a meeting, we work mainly async
check my messages on #t-compiler/wg-prioritization > New members

Hi, I am amit.I like to learn programming on my free time.Also, I have always been fascinated about the compilers and always wanted to know how things work inside. Looking forward to learn and possibly contribute to the development.
Thank you
